chapterName: Go Forth: Through Creation to Gubbio
bookTitle: St. Francis of Assisi: Passion, Poverty and the Man who Transformed the Catholic Church

questions.question: Why was Francis' heart crushed even though he knew he was making the right decision to be disassociated with his family?
questions.correctAnswer: Because his father could not see the beauty of Francis' new life
distractors: Because he would miss his mother deeply
Because he had no money or possessions
Because he feared he would never see them again
Because he was uncertain about his future

questions.question: What symbol did Francis draw onto his penitent tunic?
questions.correctAnswer: The Tau

questions.question: Which of the ten commandments did Francis worry that he wasn't following?
questions.correctAnswer: To honor his mother and father
distractors: Thou shalt have no other gods

questions.question: What was Francis renouncing when he exiled himself outside the walls of Assisi?
questions.correctAnswer: Security, sense of community and citizenship
distractors: His dreams of becoming a knight
His right to marry and have children

questions.question: What could the robbers not take away from Francis as he was walking away from Assisi toward Perugia?
questions.correctAnswer: His joy, his ability to praise the Creator

questions.question: What mode of transportation did Francis usually use prior to his exile when he traveled?
questions.correctAnswer: Riding a horse

questions.question: How did Francis feel now that he had completely separated from his former way of life?
questions.correctAnswer: He felt free, fully awake and began to feel kinship with the land
distractors: He felt afraid and uncertain about the future
He felt lonely and abandoned by everyone
He felt proud of his sacrifice for God
He felt sad but determined to continue
He felt angry at his father's rejection

questions.question: What insight did Francis have about his actions of walking around in nature?
questions.correctAnswer: As he walked, he was rejoicing in God as he felt God's love and grace pouring down on him
distractors: He realized walking was a form of penance
He understood that nature was his new home
He saw that poverty meant freedom to wander
He recognized walking as prayer in motion
He learned that solitude brought clarity

questions.question: What did the mountains remind Francis about God?
questions.correctAnswer: God's power and omnipotence

questions.question: What did the trees, their twisted trunks and deep roots, remind Francis of?
questions.correctAnswer: The old monks in the monasteries

questions.question: What did Francis reflect on regarding the oil pressed from the olive trees?
questions.correctAnswer: That the oil was used in cooking to nourish people and was used to bless by priests in benedictions
distractors: That it represented the Holy Spirit anointing believers
That it showed how suffering produces blessing
That it demonstrated God's provision for daily needs
That it symbolized light in darkness
That it illustrated transformation through pressure

questions.question: What did the annual cycle of growth, harvest and reseeding remind Francis of?
questions.correctAnswer: The Paschal Mystery, Christ's life, death and resurrection
distractors: The liturgical year and seasons of the church
The cycle of sin and redemption
The rhythm of prayer throughout the day
The journey from birth to eternal life

questions.question: Since all was created by one God, Francis saw all creation as what?
questions.correctAnswer: Good

questions.question: When Francis prayed the Our Father, he felt like he was declaring that all people were what?
questions.correctAnswer: Fraternal

questions.question: Why did Francis believe he saw Christ the most in other people?
questions.correctAnswer: Because they are made in the image and likeness of God
distractors: Because Christ said 'whatever you do to the least, you do to me'
Because all people are temples of the Holy Spirit
Because Jesus became human to show God's love
Because Christ dwells in the hearts of believers
Because all people are called to be saints

questions.question: As a nature mystic, what did Francis do from time to time?
questions.correctAnswer: Preach to the birds

questions.question: What scripture was Francis reminded of when he began to feel anxious while walking through nature?
questions.correctAnswer: Matthew 6:28-30 about the lilies of the field and how God clothes them
distractors: Matthew 6:25-27 about not worrying about your life
Psalm 23 about the Lord being my shepherd
Matthew 11:28 about coming to Jesus for rest
Philippians 4:6-7 about not being anxious about anything
1 Peter 5:7 about casting all anxieties on God

questions.question: Where did Francis stay for some time which was close to Gubbio?
questions.correctAnswer: In a Benedictine Monastery

questions.question: Why did Francis NOT see his vocation as being part of a monastic community?
questions.correctAnswer: Because of his wanderlust and desire to live in poverty on the open road sharing the gospel with others
distractors: Because he didn't want to submit to a religious superior
Because he felt called to preach rather than pray
Because monasteries were too focused on study
Because he wanted to serve the poor directly
Because he disagreed with monastic rules

questions.question: Who was the merchant friend in Gubbio that offered Francis hospitality and a new tunic? How were they acquainted?
questions.correctAnswer: Frederico Spadalunga; they fought together in the battle against Perugia
distractors: Antonio Bernardone; they were childhood friends in Assisi
Giovanni di Paolo; they had traveled together to Rome
Marco Rufino; they had worked together in the textile business
Pietro Cattani; they had met at San Damiano
Leonardo Graziano; they had studied together as youth

questions.question: Who did Francis serve while in Gubbio?
questions.correctAnswer: The lepers

questions.question: What decision did Francis make after a few months in Gubbio because of God's voice in his head?
questions.correctAnswer: To go back to Assisi to rebuild God's house
distractors: To travel to Rome to see the Pope
To establish a new community of brothers
To go on pilgrimage to Jerusalem
To preach throughout all of Italy
To write a rule for religious life
